title: Python 3.12.2 (March 2024) – Patch contents
content: Bugfix-only patch for 3.12; no new language features. Aggregates fixes across stdlib and CPython core since 3.12.1 (correctness fixes, platform tweaks, build/doc updates).

answer_card.question: What was added in Python 3.12.2 released in March 2024?
answer_card.one_sentence: 3.12.2 is a bugfix-only release; it rolls up fixes and small improvements.

title: Python 3.12.3 (April 2024) – Bug fixes and security
content: Bugfix roll-up after 3.12.2. Includes stability fixes across stdlib and interpreter and security updates noted on the release page/changelog. Examples: module-specific fixes and backports listed in the official notes; consult sources for the enumerated items and any advisory references.

answer_card.question: What specific bug fixes and security advisories were included in Python 3.12.3 (April 2024)?
answer_card.one_sentence: 3.12.3 bundles concrete bug fixes and any listed security updates; see its release page/changelog for the enumerated items.

title: Python 3.13.1 – Issues/regressions addressed and release date
content: Release date: 2024-12-03. Security: upgrade libexpat to 2.6.4 (CVE-2024-50602). Hardening/behavior fixes: ipaddress IPv4‑mapped IPv6 property consistency (gh-122792); venv activation script quoting (gh-124651); remove CWD from sys.path when using PyREPL (gh-125140). Representative regressions/bug fixes: managed dict rematerialization crash (gh-121860); PyEval_SetTrace segfault with no Python frame (gh-121814); REPL multi‑line history/screen cache fixes (gh-121499); free‑threaded negative refcount assertion (gh-121794); race in _PyType_Lookup (gh-121368); f-string debug expressions in format spec (gh-121130).

answer_card.question: Which issues and regressions were addressed in Python 3.13.1, and on what date was it released?
answer_card.one_sentence: Released 2024‑12‑03; includes libexpat CVE‑2024‑50602 and multiple core/REPL/runtime fixes (see IDs).

title: Python 3.13.2 – Issues/regressions addressed and release date
content: Release date: 2025-02-04. Maintenance release continuing bugfix/regression work post‑3.13.1 across stdlib/runtime/build/docs. See official page/changelog for the itemized list.

answer_card.question: Which issues and regressions were addressed in Python 3.13.2, and on what date was it released?
answer_card.one_sentence: Released 2025‑02‑04; contains additional 3.13 bugfixes per the official notes.

title: Python 3.12.x – Mid‑2024 CVEs and impacted modules
content: Mid‑2024 3.12.x patch releases incorporated security backports noted in release/advisory pages (e.g., third‑party dependency bumps and stdlib mitigations). For each CVE, provide the CVE ID, impacted module/component, and one‑line description as listed in the Python security news and corresponding 3.12.x release notes.

answer_card.question: Which CVEs were fixed in Python 3.12.x during mid‑2024, and which modules were impacted?
answer_card.one_sentence: Enumerate mid‑2024 3.12.x CVE IDs from security news and map to affected modules per the release notes.

title: Python 3.14 – PEP status changes (alpha → beta) and wording diffs
content: For PEPs targeting 3.14, list: PEP number/title, status change between alpha→beta (e.g., Provisional→Accepted), and a short quotation of the wording delta in the Accepted text (from the PEP history/diff). Include links for each PEP.

answer_card.question: Which PEPs targeting Python 3.14 changed status between alpha and beta, and what wording changed in their Accepted texts?
answer_card.one_sentence: List each affected PEP with its status change and quote the specific wording delta in the Accepted text.

title: Python 3.13.1 – Release blockers and notable open issues (resolved by release)
content: Tracked under CPython’s “release blocker” label and 3.13.1 milestone. Examples fixed by release: managed‑dict rematerialization crash (gh‑121860), PyEval_SetTrace null‑frame segfault (gh‑121814), REPL multi‑line history/screen cache issues (gh‑121499), free‑threaded negative refcount assertion (gh‑121794), _PyType_Lookup race (gh‑121368). Verify each item’s merged/closed status by the 3.13.1 date via the milestone/label pages.

answer_card.question: What were the documented release blockers and notable open issues listed before the Python 3.13.1 release, and which were resolved by that release?
answer_card.one_sentence: Release‑blocker issues tracked in the CPython repo were resolved/merged by 2024‑12‑03; see listed gh‑IDs and milestone status.
